deck: An Adaptoid sleeper agent created by and working for Father
description:
Origin

Swine was created by Father and is an adaptoid. His purpose is to find and retrieve any of the Descendants living among us. Before being activated and sent to retrieve a member of the Descendant's in Pakistan, Swine was working as a cop in Juarez, Mexico.

Creation

Swine was created by Rick Remender and debuted in Secret Avengers #22

Major Story Arcs

Swine is activated when a Descendant in Pakistan uses her powers. He heads there to retrieve her and her son along with Urn, Ideal and Origin. They arrive to where the woman and child are being kept only to run into the Secret Avengers. Swine attacks Captain Britain and overpowers him, kicking him through a wall. He and the other adaptoids defeat the Secret Avengers and return to their city, the Core with the woman and child. Ant-Man sneaks along, shrunk down and hidden in Urn's pant leg. He reveals himself and tries to free the child but is chased by Swine and Urn. When they catch up to him they stomp him down as it appears Ant-Man is killed. Swine continues after the child with Urn as they run into Black Widow and Valkyrie. He smashes Black Widow's face into the ground and attacks Valkyrie with her own sword, shattering her shoulder.

Venom arrives and saves Valkyrie by attacking Swine. He is able to adapt to Venom's symbiote and begins to tear Flash apart. Flash webs Valkyrie's sword and whips it into Swine's chest. As the Secret Avengers attempt to leave with the child Swine impales Jim Hammond in a last attempt to grab the child.

Powers & Abilities

As with all adaptoids, Swine has the ability to adapt to his opponents and evolve to their fighting abilities and powers.

issue_credits.name: A Victory for the Little Guy

name: Swine

deck: An Adaptoid sleeper agent created by and working for Father
description:
Origin

Urn was created by Father and is an adaptoid. His purpose is to find and retrieve any of the Descendants living among us. Before being activated and sent to retrieve a member of the Descendant's in Pakistan, Urn was living as a construction worker in Ashdod, Israel.

Creation

Urn was created by Rick Remender and artist Gabriel Hardman and debuted in Secret Avengers #22.

Major Story Arcs

Urn is activated and sent to retrieve a woman and child in Pakistan who have used their Descendant powers. Father sends Urn along with Swine, the Ideal and the Origin to retrieve them. As Urn and his fellow adaptoids arrive as do the Secret Avengers with the same mission. Urn takes down Hawkeye and uses his own bow against Black Widow. Urn and the adaptoids flee with the woman and child however, Ant-Man hides in the leg of Urn's pants and returns with them. They take a teleporter to their city, the Core and bring the woman and child to Father. Father determines the woman is too far gone into humanity to reach her full potential and orders Urn and the adaptoids to kill her. O'Grady reveals himself and saves the child. Urn and the adaptoids catch up with O'Grady and beat him to death.

Shortly after the rest of the Secret Avengers arrive to the Core and attack Urn. Urn is stabbed through the chest by Valkyrie as she and Black Widow escape with the child. Urn recovers and catches up with Valkyrie, this time draining her Asgardian powers. As Urn is about to impale Valkyrie, Venom webs the sword and whips it out of his hands and into Swine's chest. Venom and Valkyrie take down Urn, Swine and the Ideal.

Powers & Abilities

As with all adaptoids, Urn has the ability to adapt to his opponents and evolve to their fighting abilities. He also seems to have the ability to drain his enemies powers and add them to others he's collected.

issue_credits.name: A Victory for the Little Guy

name: Urn

deck: Zatanna's agent.
name: Arnie

deck: X-666 is the Antithesis to X-23.
description:
Origin

X-666 was created by Blackheart by using his H'elian's Mirror Cauldron which creates inverted reflections of whomever stands before it. As X-23's antithesis, she appears to be everything Laura is not. Being a remorseless killer on the inside but a pure, blonde, all-American girl on the outside allows her to be "nuanced", having two layers.

Creation

X-666 was created by Rick Remender and artist Tony Moore and debuted in Venom's Circle of Four miniseries.

Major Story Arcs

Circle of Four

For further information: Venom

X-666 appears as part of Blackheart's answer to X-23 during his attempted take over of Earth. X-666 briefly takes on X-23, explaining how she's better than Laura because of her ability to hide who she truly is. After a short battle X-666 lets X-23 head off in search of Blackheart. X-666 continues to taunt X-23 along her way towards Blackheart, reminding her that her healing factor will not work in Hell. She allows Laura to continue as it will ultimately prolong her torment since she will not succeed. X-666 also tells Laura that Hell is where she belongs. Blackheart calls X-666 to convince the Ghost Rider to take his deal. Red Hulk jumps in and crushes X-666 with Venom on his back.

Powers & Abilities

X-666 seems to have similar physical abilities as X-23 but with no claws. She is armed with 2 metallic, razor sharp pom-poms.
name: X-666

deck: Charley Halstead the original golden age Psycho-Pirate.
description: Charles Halstead was a linotyper for the daily Courierwho was frustrated about his lack of advancement. His first target was The Courier and he based his crimes on emotions. Each JSA member went to solve and thwart a crime based on an emotinal based crime. The Atom was in charge of protecting Halstead. The Atom believed The JSA were captured while solving the crimes. The Atom defeats the henchmen who are dressed as members of The JSA and while the battle ensues discovers the culprit to be Halstead. The Psycho Pirate wounds The Atom after dispatching the henchmen. The Atom is able to make it back to The Courier to reveal the identity of The Psycho Pirate. The Psycho Pirate is sentenced to a long prison term and researches the mysticism of emotions until his death sometime during the 1960's.

issue_credits.name: Power Trip, Part IV of IV
The Return of the Psycho Pirate

name: Psycho-Pirate (Halstead)

deck: Russian terrorist and part-time hero. He fought alongside Cable to save a young Russian mutant named Magdalena
description:
Origin

Not much is known about Geo except that he was a Russian born terrorist and a part-time superhero.

Creation

Geo was created by Darko Macan and Igor Kordey and first appeared in Soldier X issue 3 (2002).

Major Story Arcs

From Terrorist to Hero

He first came to the attention of the X-man known as Cable when he bombed a McDonalds in Russia. He received little recognition for his perverse efforts yet was considered the prime suspect for the Armenian mobsters killed by Cable some days earlier, as both of them had metal arms. Because of this, Geo sought out Cable to make him pay for reputation damage.

Geo confronted Cable in a little village while he was carrying a young mutant girl named Magdalena out of a church. The girl had healing powers and was forced to use her mutant powers on the villagers inside her home-town by a mob. Geo started a fight against Cable, and punched a few times until an angry mob started to attack them. The mob was there to get Magdalena back. Geo however knew the mob-leader and punched him in the face for calling him a loser and threatened to break his neck if he did so again. The mob however still attacked but Geo, Cable and Magdalena managed to get away. When Soldier X retreated with the wounded girl Magdalena in a truck, Geo helped push start the truck and clambered aboard as it trundled away.

The group drove to the Saint Lenin sanctuary, which was an abandoned factory, but the mob and the ones seeking to be healed followed. Inside, Geo started a fight against Cable once again when they where in. Cable however pushed him back and wrapped the small would-be hero in iron girders, while disarming his iron arm. At that point they both heard the screams of Magdalena's mother from the brutal torturing of the mob outside. Geo broke free as Cable confronted the crowd.

Soldier X sought to carry away Magdalena's mother but was attacked by the mobsters. Geo however, his mechanical arm quickly repaired, stepped in to defend Cable and gave him enough time to retreat. Geo fought bravely but was overwhelmed by the mob and was ripped apart, leaving only his metal arm behind. Cable was to late to help Geo, but took his metal arm and gave to a priest in the church they had been hiding. Later this arm was displayed in the church like a holy relic.
name: Geo

deck: Magdalena was a young mutant girl in Russia with the gift of a healing touch, who had been targeted by the Armenian mob. Cable eventually rescued the young girl.
description:
Origin

Lena was a seemingly normal girl living in a village in Russia. One day, while playing outside with her dog, the dog got hit by a passing car, mortaly wounding the dog. Lena ran up to her dog and watched it die. She held him in her hands and suddenly, the dog returned to live. Many villagers had been witness to the car accident and the events that followed. What had happened was that Lena's mutant powers had activated, though the villagers saw it as an act from God. Lena was soon duped "Magdalena" and gained great fame all over the region.

Creation

Magdalena was created by Darko Macan and Igor Kordey and first appeared in Soldier X issue 3 (2002).

Major Story Arcs

Meeting Cable

The X-man Cable came to the attention of Lena when his former mentor Blaquesmith instructed him to find her for him. Cable traveled to Russia and soon met Lena's father, Oleg. Together they tracked Lena to a village called Krasnaya Polyana. There she was held against her will, and was forced to use her healing powers on the townspeople by her mother Vera. This all hapened in the church of her uncle Dimitri, a priest. Lena soon became known as "Magdalena". Unfortunately for Lena, each healing she performed donated a portion of her life to the recipient, and by the time Cable reached her, her heart had stopped beating. When Cable picked up her body, what little strength she had left unconsciously fed off of Cable's own mutant abilities, and she reawakened with a new power: a death touch.

Dimitri drove Cable, Lena, Oleg, and the tagalong wannabe superhero and parttime terrorist Geo to a place known as "Saint Lenin," fleeing the mobsters and the villagers, now whipped into a frenzy with the belief that Cable was an angel. The mob and villagers laid siege to "Saint Lenin". Geo heroically sacrificed himself, being ripped to pieces by the mob, to allow Cable's party time to escape.

Vera had been tortured by the mobsters as a hostage, and begged for Lena to heal her. Lena refused, on the grounds that her touch could now only kill. When Vera said she did not care, Lena reluctantly kissed her mother, putting an end to her suffering. She resolved to turn even these powers into a gift, and Cable left her and her father in peace.

Powers

Healing touch: Magdalena could heal others with a touch (usually achieved by kissing them), though use of this power actually poured some of Magdalena's life into the patient, which could leave her drained and near death.

Death touch: After absorbing Cable's power, Magdalena lost her healing powers and gained the ability to drain life with a touch.
name: Magdalena

Origin

Mei-Ling is one of the five Girl Commandos. She it the Chinese member of the team. Her family being killed by Japanese soldiers, she asked to be a member instead of being recruited like the other members. Originally thought a spy, she convinces the team and she becomes the last member to join.
name: Mei-Ling

deck: The leader of an American terrorist organization. He had the abbility to see into the future, but only till one certain point in time. That point was when he met the X-man named Cable.
description:
Origin

When Jonas Keller was a young boy, he had a vision about a man with a scar in his eyes. This man turned out to be Cable, but for Jonas, it was unknown who it was. More troubling for him, he seemed to have the gift of being able to look into the future, but only until the point where he finally meets Cable, the man from his first vision. When Jonas grew up, he became a successful soldier in the United States Army, mostly thanks to his precognitive powers, and he eventually became the youngest Colonel in Army history after witch he was transferred to Special Forces, as a part of which he vanished in the Middle East.

Creation

Jonas Keller was created by Karl Bollers and Arthur Ranson and first appeared in Soldier X issue 9 (2003).

Major Story Arcs

Meeting Cable

Jonas resurfaced year later, back in America. But this time as leader of the white supremacist terrorist group known as W.A.R., which he started not because he was a racist, but simply to prove he could get people willing to die and kill for him under his power. When W.A.R. bombed an Airport, the Army brought in Cable to take Jonas down.

Keller had foreseen this because, as it turned out, he wanted to meet Cable. He arranged for several of his own men to die in a suicide bombing on Cable, which he knew Cable could survive. Cable read the mind of a badly-injured survivor of the bombing to learn Keller's location and confronted him. Keller bragged to Cable about the success his powers had brought him. But he also admitted that he was horrified to find out why he could no longer see into the future after the point that Cable visited him. When Jonas made a swing at him, Cable telepathically removed Jonas' powers. He then left Jonas Keller alone. Feeling more lost then ever, not knowing what was to come for the first time in his life, Jonas Keller shot and killed himself.

It turned out that Jonas shooting himself made it so that Jonas could not see into the future after his meeting with Cable.......It was because he no longer had a future.
name: Jonas Keller

deck: Alien worshiper and herald of Galactus in Earth-829
description:
An unnamed alien from a group known only as the Kawa Brotherhood - a race of beings who worshiped and provided worlds for Galactus. A planetary scout, he arrived to find that his race had been defeated by Hercules and destroyed themselves instead of face their god. Swearing vengeance, the being searched for Galactus for decades.

Once he found him, he offered himself to become his new herald and became the new Silver Surfer. When Galactus consumed too much energy and became a massive, galaxy destroying black hole, the alien was freed from his service. He immediately sought vengeance on Hercules. In their battle, the alien killed Hercules' grandson Ursus. This caused great anger in the Lion of Olympus, who defeated the alien and beheaded him with his own board.

issue_credits.name: A Cosmic Blast from the Past!

issues_died_in.name: A Cosmic Blast from the Past!

name: Alien Silver Surfer

deck: Born of Hercules' sacrifice in saving Galactus (Earth-829), Cosmos became a sort of anti-Galactus - the Bringer of Worlds
description:
An event caused Galactus, the Devourer of Worlds, to consume too much energy. When this happened, Galactus increased in mass, growing into a massive black hole. This black hole continued to grow, threatening the entire Andromeda Galaxy.

A device was made to attempt to stop this, a white hole bomb, that if successful would free Galactus and stop the expansion. Only Hercules was able to deliver the device. It was successful, but cost Hercules his life. But in the separation, Galactus also separated. A new being was born - Cosmos - the Bringer of Worlds.

Instead of destruction, Cosmos would bring life to planets, create new star systems and heal dying stars.
name: Cosmos

deck: Womble engineer.
description:
Named after the capital of the Isle of Mull in Scotland's Outer Hebrides, Tobermory is a member of the Wimbledon Common Wombles, and their main engineer.

Originally created for Elisabeth Beresford's children books, the Wombles went on to star in TV shows, a live action film, and comics, including Teddy Bear and Jack and Jill, as well as their own annuals.
name: Tobermory

deck: Windmill owner who lives near the village of Camberwick Green.
description:
Origin

Windy Miller is the resident of Colly's Mill, a windmill set atop a hill near the village of Camberwick Green, Trumptonshire, where he grinds corn and barley. An old fashioned man, he brews his own cider, rides a penny farthing bicycle, and wears a traditional blue miller's smock and Quaker hat.

Creation

Windy Miller was one of the many characters who inhabited the children's puppet show Camberwick Green, which debuted on 3rd March 1966 on BBC 1, and proved to be one of the best loved and most remembered of the characters. Despite only lasting one series of thirteen episodes, it spawned two follow-on shows, Trumpton and Chigley (the latter a village near Camberwick Green), with Windy also appearing in the latter.

Though together all three shows only accrued three years and 39 episodes, it was frequently repeated into the 1970s, and ten Camberwick Green Annuals were published between 1967 and 1976. Chigley had two annuals (1970 and 1971), while Trumpton had eight (1967 to 1974). All three series also had strips in Polystyle's Pippin in Playland.
name: Windy Miller

The books were adapted to the radio in 1929, where the stuttering character of Larry the Lamb and his best friend, Dennis the Dachsund, swiftly became favourites of listeners as their innocent misadventures caused consternation amongst other Toytown residents.

description:
Origin

Sooty began life as a bear puppet bought from a market stall in 1948 by magician and comedian Harry Corbett for his son Matthew when the family were on holiday.

Background

Harry incorporated the puppet into his act, and came to national prominence on BBC 1's Talent Night show in 1952.

Sooty also had several annuals, starting in 1957 and released almost every year since, moving from one publisher to the next. Sooty also appeared in both TV Comic and later Pippin.
name: Sooty

deck: A new Superman villainess who "can't be touched".
description:
Origin

According to Anguish, she was raised by her abusive stepfather after her mother passed away in a housefire. Her stepfather eventually kicked her out and took a locket from her containing the only existing picture of her mother, her stepfather then hid it away in a safety deposit box out of resentment towards Anguish for still being alive and him having to take care of her. It was due to searching for and finding this locket in a Metropolis bank that she ran into Superman, making her debut.

Creation

Anguish was created by Superman writers/artists Keith Giffen and Dan Jurgens. Originally solicited as Masochist, her name was later changed to Anguish.

Powers & Abilities

Super-strength

At least enough to effortlessly lift a news-van, or sucker-punch Superman across a street with force enough to shatter a concrete wall.

Phasing

Her body seems to instinctively change density when attacked allowing bullets and energy (Superman's eye lasers) alike to pass clear through her body.

deck: Jughead's Cousin
description:
Origin

Souphead Jones was Jughead's cousin who visited Riverdale from time to time, almost the identical twin of Jughead in looks, dress and temperament their only differences are that Souphead is shorter than Jughead, and he prefers soup to hamburgers.

Creators

Yeah, talk about characterization! Souphead appeared for the first year or so during the first year when Archie and his gang got their own comic, and occasionally on the Archie radio show in the 40s, then mostly went away with reappearances now and then right up until modern times, or as modern as they get with Archie.
name: Souphead Jones

deck: Urdron was one of the aliens who was held captive by the Kryl. He helped Mr. Terrific to fight the Kryl back.
description:
Creation

Urdron was created by Eric Wallace and frist appeared after the DC relaunch of 2011.

Origin

Like his race, Urdron was pursued the ways of war. Before he was held captive he was a Battle Commander.
name: Urdron

deck: Boy wizard from the 1960s.
description: Created by Alan McKenzie and John Ridgway, Luke Kirby appears in his own series in 2000AD.
name: Luke Kirby

deck: Py'Lothia is an Cepniac'n alien with the power to absorb and manipulate energy.
description:
Creation

Py'Lothia was created by Eric Wallace and first appeared after the relaunch of 2011.

Origin

The cosmos fears the sight of a Kryl recruitment ship but the Cepniac'n welcomed it, because it meant the tribe elders could rid themselves of Py'Lothia. Cepniac'n individuals develop the ability to harness all forms of energy once their gender stabilizes and they learn to focus. Cepniac'n females can absorb energy, whilte their male counterparts manipulate and expel it. But Py'Lothia was born with male and female characteristics, and have yet to stabilize. No matter how hard Py'Lothia tried, Py'Lothia can't because Py'Lothia don't want to choose. That's why everyone said Py'Lothia is not normal like the rest of the Cepniac'n race. Py'Lothias parents gave her to the Kryl because they were ashamed. They always said Py'Lothia should have died at birth.

Storyarc
name: Py'Lothia

deck: 'Unarmed prisoners...they must be fairly treated, sir...'
description:
Scripted by Pete Milligan and illustrated by Brett Ewins and Jim McCarthy, Commander Peck appears in the first two episodes of Bad Company, a story from the pages of weekly British anthology comic 2000AD.

Peck was the Commander of the First Colony Infantry (which included a green Danny Franks). Outnumbered by the Krool, Peck and his team are saved by Bad Company and 'forced' to join them.

Peck is appalled by the renegades' methods and is determined to do everything 'by the book'. During a battle he captures what he thinks is an unarmed Krool. He's wrong, and the Krool slaughters him with a concealed knife.
name: Commander Peck

deck: 'Drop dead, Peck! This is probably my last day alive. I don't want your voice to be the last thing I hear.'
description:
Scripted by Pete Milligan and illustrated by Brett Ewins and Jim McCarthy, Trucker is a member of Bad Company, a story from the pages of weekly British anthology comic 2000AD.

Best friend to Danny Franks - he's killed by the Krool's 'zombie beat' sonic attacks.
name: Trucker

deck: 'The main rule is: DON'T GET FRIENDLY. You have to hate your comrade's guts...so when he's killed - no problem, it's just another soldier gone.'
description:
Scripted by Pete Milligan and illustrated by Brett Ewins and Jim McCarthy, Malcolme is a member of Bad Company, a story from the pages of weekly British anthology comic 2000AD.

He dies saving Danny Franks from heavy Krool bombardment. He later comes back as a Krool war zombie, but this time Danny puts him down for good.
name: Malcolm

deck: 'Zu wan I go wiz Scummer an' check it out, Zianti?'
description:
Scripted by Pete Milligan and illustrated by Brett Ewins and Jim McCarthy, Gobber is a member of Bad Company, a story from the pages of weekly British anthology comic 2000AD.

Gobber dies when the team is ambushed by Krool.
name: Gobber

deck: 'Don't listen to my arm, boys. If it wasn't for me it'd still be living in the dirt.'
description:
Scripted by Pete Milligan and illustrated by Brett Ewins and Jim McCarthy, Flytrap is a member of Bad Company, a story from the pages of weekly British anthology comic 2000AD.

After losing an arm in an earlier Krool skirmish, he has a strange Ararat plant grafted onto him in its place. As Ararat starts to die, the arm, a part of the planet, becomes diseased and starts to die also. The team try to amputate it, but too late to save Flytrap...
name: Flytrap

deck: 'Aaarrrrooooo!'
description:
Scripted by Pete Milligan and illustrated by Brett Ewins and Jim McCarthy, Dogbrain is a member of Bad Company, a story from the pages of weekly British anthology comic 2000AD.

Once a human, until the Krool experimented on him, replacing his brain with that of a dogs. As a wild 'wolfman' that only team leader Kano could control, Dogbrain dies during the final assault on the Krool base on Ararat.
name: Dogbrain

deck: 'Ah...the end, I think. I am matter, therefore I don't matter. No soul, just death. Do please join me...'
description:
Scripted by Pete Milligan and illustrated by Brett Ewins and Jim McCarthy, Wallbanger is a member of Bad Company, a story from the pages of weekly British anthology comic 2000AD.

Wallbanger is Bad Company's robot medic. During the final assault on the Krool base on Ararat, Wallbanger is caught in a rock collapse, surrounded by Krool and blown to bits.
name: Wallbanger

deck: 'It's really quite simple. I don't destroy anything. I just move my mind into things. And make their atoms dance.'
description:
Sheeva created by writer Peter Milligan and artists Brett Ewins and Jim McCarthy, she appears in the 2000AD series Bad Company.

Sheeva was a 'boom baby' - the result of an experiment to give young babies extra intelligence. What the experiment actually gave her was the ability to make 'atoms dance' and explode.

Sheeva joined Bad Company and formed an emotional link to Danny Franks. She gives her life on the final assault on the Krool Heart in an effort to give Franks time to get to it before Protoid does.
name: Sheeva

deck: Baldwin is a former killer of the secret consortium known as "The Company"
name: Jack Baldwin

deck: Idea is a deady samurai killer working for "The Company"
description:
Yoko Yubari was the sister of a yakuza crimelord of East City, that was killed by his associates when she was a youn girl. Her life was saved by Aleph, the woman that would become the head of the secret organization known as the Company. So Yoko devoted her life to Aleph and started following the way of the samurai.

She became part of the team of the Empty Men, a group of men and women with "nothing to lose", used as a special squad by Aleph. Among them she took the codename of Idea, the others being Act, Motion, Reality and Shadow.

As she was forced to kill her lover and companion Motion during a mission, she swore revenge against Aleph and the whole Company.
name: Idea

deck: A "neo-noir" hero of Colt City.
description:
Creation

Black Beetle was created by Francesco Francavilla, debuting in Dark Horse Presents #11.

Francesco held a poll in the blog Pulp Sunday, asking the fans which character they would rather to see: The Black Beetle or Max Malone. The readers choose The Black Beetle with more than two-thirds of the voter. Francesco described him at the time as "in the vein of masked vigilante pulp in some sort of '40s/'50s settings, with some slight (40s/50s) sci-fi tone to it".

first_appeared_in_issue.name: The Black Beetle; Amala's Blade; Finder: Third World; Criminal Macabre; House of Fun; The Occultist; The Creep; Pig; Blood; The White Suits

name: Black Beetle

volume_credits.name: The Black Beetle: No Way Out

deck: Aleph is the Chief Executive Officer and leader of the secret consortium known as The Company.
description:
Ruby was the only sister of Eleanor Higgins. Once a simple and poor woman, Eleanor entered the Company as an employee and soon became one of its managers. Each of the twelve men who founded the company donated their semen to make Eleanor pregnant, so when a girl was born, nobody knew who among them was the real father, and they all considered the girl to be their sister.

While her mother called her Ruby, her twelve fathers gave her the name Aleph. When she was 18 years old they unanimously decided to put the company in her hands.
name: Aleph

deck: Alexander is the best friend of Mikhail Rasputin.
description:
Alexander went to school with Mikhail Rasputin. Alexander was a good friend of Mikhail for a long time. He was present when the family received the bad news about Mikhail´s death.

Alexander discovered the Piotr´s secret and was contacted by Professor X to help him.

Alexander became into the Director of Intelligence in Russia.
name: Alexander Vahzin

deck: Ivan works for The Federal Security Service in Moscow.
description:
Ivan was spying to Piotr for 6 years in Siberia, trying to discover his secret.

Ivan also organized the operation to capture to Colossus.
name: Ivan Dubenko

deck: Also known as Black Rock Shooter(OVA and Black Rock Chan) and Rock(Black Rock Shooter ~Innocent Soul~), she is the main chharacter from Black Rock Shooter who uses a giant cannon as her main weapon and a sword as secondary weapon.
description:
OVA and Black Rock Chan

She's shown as the other self of a middle school studen called Mato Kuroi. Everything that happens to Mato interfere in Black Rock Shooter's world somehow.
name: Stella

deck: The loyal companion of John Blacksad, Weekly is a weasel with a nose for trouble. He has a knack for finding crucial evidence and has proven to be invaluable to John's various cases.
description:
Creation

Weekly was created by Juan Diaz Canales  and Juanjo Guarnido for the Blacksad comic book series.  
 

Arctic Nation

Making his first appearance in the second book of Blacksad, Weekly encounter John very early on in the issue after a racial hate crime is committed in town square. Though initially cold to Weekly, John warms up to him after the two engage in friendly conversation and exchange of ideas at a soda parlor. In a town full of race wars, it seems natural that two misfits should come together. Weekly gives tidbits of information about both the Black Claws and the White Arctic Nation. After a brawl, the two are brought before the town sheriff Karup. Weekly does little more than annoy the man and cause John grief.  
 
Later, after John investigates the case with a woman named Dinah (the mother of the missing girl Kylie), Weekly is beaten and threatened with to deliver a message from the Black Claws to the newspaper. Of course, Weekly doesn't give in to bullying and prints the information on his own accord. Weekly does discover a major point in the case when he spies on Jezebel, the sheriff's wife, cheating on him with a subordinate named Huk.  
 
Weekly is later captured by Huk and brought to the abandoned airplane factory to be executed. John saves him and together with a man named Cotton, they find Kylie. Cotton dies before they can escape, however. At the close of the story arc, Weekly confesses that the reason his name is Weekly is that the secretary made a joke that he only changes his clothes once a week. John responds with a hearty laugh in order to make his new friend feel a little better.
name: Weekly

deck: Judge sent to the moon-based colony of Luna-1 for a six month tour of duty as Judge Marshal.
description: Judge King stars in the 2000ad story Breathing Space (Prog 1451-1459).
name: Judge King

deck: Caim is the main protagonist of Drakengard.
description:
Drakengard

Caim is a warrior who is seeking revenge against the Empire. He slays hundreds of countless foes, defending the Goddess (his sister Furiae). Just then, he learned that the Empire has captured a red dragon.
 
He went to this castle and goes into rage. It is revealed that his parents are murdered by a black dragon; this is the reason why he becomes the warrior that he is. Just as he is about to deliver the killing blow, the dragon speaks that he may kill her, but her soul will never be dirty. Caim asks her if she still wants to live, suggesting for a pact.
 
Before the red dragon gives her answer, more Empire soldiers are attacking. Caim has proven his worthiness by slaying countless of them; this makes the dragon agree a pact between them. Both of them are healed from their wounds and continue on to fight against the Empire.
 
Howeverm the price of the pact Caim made is his voice. This is shown when his tongue has a mark.
name: Caim

deck: Lilija Eriksdottir is the director of the Conscientia Institute's Icelandic Satellite. She's also an old flame of Michael Holt.
description:
Creation

Dr. Lilija "Lily" Eriksdottir was created by Eric Wallace and Ollie Nome as an old flame of Mr. Terrific. She first appeared after the DC relaunch of 2011.
name: Lilija Eriksdottir

deck: Bosco is a dog.
description:
Origin

Bosco is an ill fated dog, who was sold to Young Smiley West under the lie of being a gold finding dog.  Well, of course the dog could not sniff out gold.  Knowing that he got ripped off West sees his girlfriend in trouble and put his horse at full speed, and in the process the horse stepd on and kills Bosco.  After saving his girlfriend West digs a grave for Bosco and finds gold.  Making Bosco a gold finding dog after all.

Origin

John Wendel is the ranch owner of the Circle Q Ranch.  He steals horses from the Bar B Ranch and was trying to put them out of business.  That is until the Rio Kid stepped in.

deck: Satan is a wild horse considered the worst killer in the west.
description:
Origin

Satan was a wild horse.  It was considered the worst killer in the west.  He was eventually caught and broken by the Rio Kid for the Bar B Ranch.  The horse and it's pack allowed the Bar B to stay in business.

deck: Leader of short-lived all-women dynasty of crime. With the aid of a crooked professor, formulated a pill specially-made to depower Supergirl, which succeeded, although temporarily.
name: Starfire

deck: Reporter obsessed with Glory.
description:
Since childhood, Riley idolized and dreamed of the superheroine Glory. Several years after Glory's disappearance, Riley decided to search for the missing superheroine as part of her journalism thesis.

Riley found Gloria West, who lived in France on the island of Mont Saint-Michel. Gloria explained that Glory had been brutally attacked and was still recovering.

Later that night, Glory told Riley that they had expected her. That she would be needed. Because something terrible would happen soon.

Riley dreamed of a future in which Glory had crippled humanity. Riley found out she would have to stop Glory.

Not long after, Mont St-Michel was attacked by the forces of Lord Silverfall, Glory's father and most sworn enemy. It was a rescue party for Riley. Silverfall wanted to get her to safety, because only she can stop Glory.

Riley, Glory and their friends escaped from Lord Silverfall's army.

deck: Elania Elmore is the Chairman of the Security Council of the Earth, in the XXII Century of the Nathan Never continuity. After the end of the war against the martian Praetorians, Elmore becomes the new head of Alfa Agency.
description:
Elania is a strong but sensitive woman. She has a son, Matthew, and a relationship with head of Alfa Agency Solomon Darver.

After the end of the war against the martian Praetorians, Elmore becomes the new head of Alfa Agency, while Darver shift to the leadrship of the Security Council.
name: Elania Elmore

deck:
Gloria Anderson is the president of the Orbiting Stations Confederation after the indipendence from Earth. 
She is one of the many supporting characters in Nathan Never Comic created by Stefano Vietti in the 2000s.
description: Gloria Anderson was a member of the Orbiting Stations Senate during the war against the Earth (se Guerra delle stazioni orbitanti story arc). A strong and determined woman, after the death of former president Ada Morgan, Anderson was elected as the first president of the new independent confederation, and, in the aftermath of the war, she was one of the main proponents of the process of detente between the orbiting stations and the Earth. She became a close ally of President Abraham of the United Nations, and at the beginning of the invasion of the Earth by the Martian Pretorians (seethe Guerra dei mondi story arc), she rejected the threats of the Pretorian leader Kos Aradan I and sided with the Earth, her former enemy.
name: Gloria Anderson

deck: A young Gotham professional whose mind was taken over by the mind controlling leader of the Cleaners, Choke.
name: Brendan Bowman

deck: Darko is an evil crimelord whose interest lie primarly on human clonation

deck: A New York City detective who had an encounter with the Teen Titans. She was born in the 31st century.
description:
Origin

Jocelyn Lure is from the 31st century.

Creation

Jocelyn Lure was was created by Scott Lobdell and Brett Booth

Character Evolution

Major Story Arcs

Teen Titans: It's Our Right to Fight

For more information see: Teen Titans: It's Our Right to Fight

Acting as a Detective of the NYPD, Jocelyn Lure comes in contact with the Teen Titans after their fight with Superboy. Though the group of teens escape, Lure seems to be fixated on one, Bart Allen. Back in her office, she speaks to herself in Interlac, a language from the 31st century, wondering why Bart Allen is in the 21st century, claiming that he's a long tenured criminal.

issue_credits.name: High School And Other Assorted Horrors

name: Jocelyn Lure

volume_credits.name: Teen Titans: It's Our Right to Fight
